content.title: Training in Handicrafts
content.details: The 'Training in Handicrafts' Component of the 'Development Of Handicrafts' Scheme aims to create better employment opportunities and enhance the livelihood of the rural poor. The training adopts a Gurukulam model, emphasizing learning the craft within its environment.
benefits: Trainees will receive a stipend of ₹1,500 per month.
Master craftspersons will be compensated with an honorarium of ₹300 per trainee (up to ₹3,000 per month), and ₹150 per trainee per month for raw material wastage (up to ₹1,500 per month).
The Training commences in December and is for a period of 6 months.
eligibility: The applicant should be a native of the Union Territory of Puducherry or a continuous resident for the past three years.
The applicant should be between 18 and 35 years of age.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should print the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all mandatory fields, attach required documents, and submit it to the Project Manager (Cottage Industries).

faqs.question: What is the primary objective of the 'Training in Handicrafts' component under the 'Development Of Handicrafts' scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective is to create better employment opportunities and enhance the livelihood of the rural poor.

faqs.question: When is the application period for the training, and how is it announced?
faqs.answer: Applications are accepted in July, and advertisements are published in local dailies during the same month.

faqs.question: When does the training for the 'Training in Handicrafts' scheme commence?
faqs.answer: Training commencement is scheduled for December.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the training period for the scheme?
What stipend will trainees receive during the 6-month training period?
faqs.answer: Trainees will receive a stipend of ₹1500 per month.

faqs.question: How are master craftspersons compensated under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Master craftspersons receive an honorarium of ₹300 per trainee (up to ₹3000 per month) and ₹150 per trainee per month for raw material wastage (up to ₹1500 per month).

faqs.question: Can you list some of the crafts practiced under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Soapstone carving, Pith Craft, Tapestry, Wood carving, Bronze Icon, Serpentine stone carving, Terracotta, and many others.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants should be between 18 and 35 years of age and native of the Union Territory of Puducherry or continuous residents for the past three years.

faqs.question: How can citizens access the Citizen's Charter for more details?
Where can citizens find the Grievance Redressal mechanism for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Grievance Redressal mechanism is available at https://industry.py.gov.in/grievance-redressal-mechanism.

faqs.question: What is the compensation for raw material wastage for master craftspersons?
faqs.answer: Master craftspersons receive ₹150 per trainee per month for raw material wastage (up to ₹1500 per month).
